sentences.en: Even the smallest change - Obama's penholder, for example - is closely watched for symbolism.
sentences.cn: 甚至是奥巴马的 笔筒 这种最不起眼的变化, 都被视为某种象征而受到密切关注.

sentences.en: I flung away the cigar with a certain wasteful symbolism.
sentences.cn: 我以一种略带浪费的意味扔掉了雪茄.

sentences.en: Langer is built on philosophy base of new symbolism.
sentences.cn: 朗格的美学思想建立在新符号论的哲学基点上.

sentences.en: Maddie: No, It'shows the role symbolism had in jade carving.
sentences.cn: 曼蒂: 不, 这个玉雕是在显示一种角色象征.

sentences.en: Poetry is more subtle - it uses metaphors and symbolism to express ideas.
sentences.cn: 诗歌是精妙的,它使用隐喻和象征来表达意念.

sentences.en: Symbolism in wide rang is also a distinctive feature of his poetry.
sentences.cn: 大范围地使用象征手法也是他作品的鲜明特征.

sentences.en: The film was much praised at the time for its visual symbolism.
sentences.cn: 那部电影由于其视觉上的象征主义而在当时大受褒扬。

sentences.en: The scene is so rich in symbolism that any explanation risks spoiling the effect.
sentences.cn: 该场景具有丰富的象征意义，任何解释都可能破坏其效果。

sentences.en: The symbolism of every gesture will be of vital importance during the short state visit.
sentences.cn: 在这次短暂的国事访问期间，一举一动都将有着至关重要的象征意义。

sentences.en: The wall has long been incorporated into Chinese mythology popular symbolism.
sentences.cn: 长城成为了中国的象征,关于它还有许多传说.

sentences.en: There I was inundated with a mass of symbolism.
sentences.cn: 我被大量的象征符号所包围.

sentences.en: There is no doubting the political symbolism of this crushing defeat.
sentences.cn: 这一溃败无疑具有政治象征意义.

sentences.en: Throughout her history she is accompanies by serpent symbolism.
sentences.cn: 在整个她的历史期间以蛇伴随,象征她自己.

sentences.en: Vienna Secession is a symbolism junta of Vienna in the 19 th century.
sentences.cn: 维也纳“分离画派”是十九世纪奥地利的象征主义派别.

sentences.en: We shall encounter some of his symbolism in our survey of the calculus.
sentences.cn: 以后在概述微积分发展时,我们将碰到他所创立的一些符号.

trans.tran_en: the use of symbols to represent ideas or qualities
